UZ.evidence: China provided Uzbekistan’s military with humanitarian aid to combat the COVID-19 pandemic.
UZ.answerer: Answered by Farkhod Tolipov, and has been reviewed by Ani Kintsurashvili

TJ.note:
The Chinese Government granted $764,526 of humanitarian aid for natural disaster relief in Tajikistan.
https://china.aiddata.org/projects/57839/

China provided food, tents, and sheets to Tajikistan for harsh winter relief.
https://china.aiddata.org/projects/40441/

On July 23, 2015, Chinese Foreign Minister Wang Yi pledged to provide emergency humanitarian relief to Tajikistan during a meeting with his Tajik counterpart, Sirojiddin Aslov. Constant high temperatures since July caused glaciers to melt, leading to severe landslides in Tajikistan and causing serious casualties. On August 5, the Department of Foreign Assistance of MOFCOM delivered RMB 10 million in relief to Tajikistan.
https://china.aiddata.org/projects/53944/
TJ.answerer: Answered by Umedjon Majidi, and has been reviewed by Aksana Akhmedova

KG.note:
On Thursday, an official ceremony took place in Bishkek for the signing of the act of acceptance and transfer of humanitarian aid in the form of food provided by the Chinese government to the population of Kyrgyzstan (2021).
https://bigasia.ru/en/content/news/society/kyrgyzstan-receives-humanitarian-aid-from-china/

China to provide military assistance to Kyrgyzstan (2022). The Chinese side expressed its readiness to provide military-technical assistance, which could include communication tools or technical equipment.
https://24.kg/english/240746_China_to_provide_military_assistance_to_Kyrgyzstan/
KG.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by Ani Kintsurashvili

JO.note:
http://jo.china-embassy.gov.cn/ara/dtxw/202111/t20211105_10444488.htm - Jordan receives a second batch of Sinopharm vaccine donated by China
In 2013, China provided humanitarian assistance to Jordan to help with the Syrian refugees in Jordan. https://www.fmprc.gov.cn/mfa_eng/wjb_663304/zzjg_663340/xybfs_663590/gjlb_663594/2833_663656/ 
“The People’s Republic of China has contributed USD 200,000 to IOM’s operation to provide medical aid and transport from the border to Za’atari refugee camp.
IOM has worked closely with the Jordanian Armed Forces at the border to provide medical screening and buses to transport over 100,000 new arrivals to the camp, since the site opened on July 29th 2012. Za’atari now houses over 60,000 people.”
https://www.iom.int/news/china-backs-iom-jordan-aid-syrian-refugees 
As of September 2021, the People’s Liberation Army (PLA) had delivered medical supplies and aid to at least 52 countries. The following month, stage III trials of both Sinopharm and Sinovac vaccines kicked off in five countries (Bahrain, Brazil, Egypt, Jordan, and the UAE). https://chinapower.csis.org/china-covid-medical-vaccine-diplomacy/
JO.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by Aksana Akhmedova

EG.note:
“The Chinese People’s Liberation Army (PLA) has delivered a batch of COVID-19 vaccines to the Egyptian side on September 1, 2021.” http://eng.mod.gov.cn/news/2021-09/02/content_4893833.htm                                     http://news.cn/english/2021-11/05/c_1310291142.htm
China has so far donated four batches of COVID-19 vaccines to Egypt and also localized the production of the Sinovac vaccines in Egypt, which fully demonstrates the depth of the bilateral strategic partnership.
https://apnews.com/article/health-care-reform-cairo-coronavirus-pandemic-health-covid-19-pandemic-62e56e073391f206479d4724693d53d0
Egypt receives 2nd shipment of vaccine as gift from China.
https://english.aawsat.com/home/article/2288346/egypt-enhances-medical-capabilities-through-chinese-aid
Egypt Enhances Medical Capabilities Through Chinese Aid
EG.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by Aksana Akhmedova

LB.evidence:
https://www.ad-dawra.com/2023/07/25/47239/
“In 2020, members of the Chinese peacekeeping forces went to the port of Beirut to carry out rescue operations after the disaster of the port explosion”
“Chinese peacekeeping forces provided humanitarian aid hundreds of times, donating medical parts and equipment, daily necessities, school supplies, etc. to neighboring Lebanese villages, local schools and institutes, and organizing medical visits to local villages on an ongoing basis.”                                                         http://eng.chinamil.com.cn/2022special/2022-02/08/content_10174473.htm
The 20th Chinese peacekeeping medical contingent to Lebanon donated humanitarian aid supplies in 21 categories, including groceries, food, disinfectant, and masks, to the Lebanese NGO Amel Association International in southern Lebanon.
LB.note:
http://en.brnn.com/n3/2021/0823/c415018-9886732.html 
"China is participating in the temporary United Nations peacekeeping force (UNIFIL) in Lebanon, where Prime Minister Wen Jiabao announced the deployment of 1,000 Chinese peacekeepers... China did not directly participate in the Lebanese mediation but played an indirect role by contributing through the United Nations and the UN Security Council. China also provided financial support to Lebanon." https://english.almayadeen.net/articles/blog/reflections-on-the-sinolebanese-relations 
“China's PLA donates medical supplies to Lebanese army to help fight COVID-19” http://www.xinhuanet.com/english/2020-05/28/c_139096587.htm                                  https://thegeopolitics.com/china-in-lebanon-a-mirage-of-help/
 In August of 2020, Beirut was struck by a deadly explosion that displaced approximately 300,000 inhabitants and killed approximately 150 people. On one side, where Lebanese government officials were hiding their faces, Chinese peacekeepers quickly organised themselves and began rescue operations. In addition, to prevent any more mishaps, China has ordered safety inspection projects in Lebanon.
https://www.chinadaily.com.cn/a/202111/30/WS61a581e9a310cdd39bc784f1.html
2021 - Lebanon on Monday received from China a medical donation consisting of a second batch of China's Sinopharm COVID-19 vaccines, 100 ventilators and 100 hospital beds.

https://www.chinadaily.com.cn/a/202108/29/WS612af267a310efa1bd66bd5c.html
The Chinese government decided to provide Lebanon with a new batch of Chinese-made COVID-19 vaccine to help the country fight the pandemic, the Chinese embassy in Lebanon said in a statement Saturday.

https://www.chinadaily.com.cn/a/202008/06/WS5f2bdd51a31083481725eb3d.html
The Chinese government launched an emergency response mechanism on Aug 5 to offer humanitarian assistance to Lebanon after huge explosions rocked the Port of Beirut, capital of Lebanon, the day before, causing heavy casualties and property losses, said Tian Lin, spokesperson for the China International Development Cooperation Agency (CIDCA).                                                   the Lebanese Civil Defense received two emergency rescue and survey robots donated by the Shenyang Institute of Automation of the Chinese Academy of Sciences.
For his part, the Director General of the Lebanese Civil Defense, Brigadier General Raymond Khattar, said that putting these two robots into service will enhance the capabilities of the Civil Defense, especially in the field of reconnaissance in dangerous places and taking samples of chemical, biological, radiological and nuclear (CBRN) materials and disposing of them.                                                  https://www.chinainarabic.org/?p=83948
LB.answerer: Answered by 2 anonymous experts, and has been reviewed by Aksana Akhmedova

VE.evidence: There is no observation of the Indicator phenomenon.
VE.note: In march 2019, the PLA sent toward Venezuela medicines to attend health crisis in the country. Taking into account this is a "case" indicator, I think it deserves a "NO" response.

CL.evidence:
"There are several MOU and agreements between Chinese institutions and local Disaster/Emergency Agency (ONEMI Oficina Nacional de Emergencia del Ministerio del Interior). Nevertheless, collaborations these are not executed by the PLA but other organizations such as universities and government agencies. In 2017 there was a documented training program of the Chilean Army in China.

According to the Defense Ministry: 

a) ONEMI cooperates with China in the field of Disaster Risk Management (other than HA / DR).

b) There is a cooperation program between ONEMI and the Public Security Research Institute of Tsinghua University. This program seeks to carry out knowledge exchange and cooperation on disaster risk management, including best practices, systems and innovations. 
Finally, during the pandemic the Cansino vaccine, which has said to have been developed and tested within the PLA, was the main vaccine used in Chiie. This, however, was not a donation in most cases, but a direct acquisition by Chile. "
CL.note: I'd like to discuss this answer. In 2023, the sismology organism in Chile met the Chinese equivalent, so there could be some kind of relationship.
CL.answerer: Answered by Sascha Hannig Núñez, and has been reviewed by Team Fundación Andrés Bello - Centro de Investigación Chino Latinoamericano

PH.evidence: In June 2023, the People’s Republic of China donated a total of P5 million worth of relief assistance to those affected by recent natural disasters in the Philippines, including the unrest of the Mayon Volcano and Typhoon Betty. A total of P4 million peso-worth of relief supplies were turned over by People’s Liberation Army - Navy training ship Qi Jiguang and the Chinese Embassy in Manila to the Department of Social Welfare and Development. Therefore, this Indicator deserves a "Yes" response.
PH.note:
Prior to this, the only time PLA participated in HADR efforts in the Philippines was after Typhoon Haiyan struck the country in November 2013. Observers noted that Beijing’s initial reluctance to provide humanitarian aid was likely due to its territorial dispute in the South China Sea with Manila. The deployment of PLA-Navy’s Peace Ark, with its 300 hospital beds and more than 120 medical personnel, was the first time China had sent any naval ship on a disaster relief mission abroad. 

1) https://www.uscc.gov/sites/default/files/Research/USCC%20Staff%20Report_The%20Chinese%20Military%E2%80%99s%20Role%20in%20Overseas%20Humanitarian%20Assistance%20and%20Disaster%20Relief_7.11.19.pdf 
2) http://ph.china-embassy.gov.cn/eng/zt/117/201311/t20131125_1334535.htm
PH.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 2 anonymous experts.

UG.evidence: China has provided humanitarian relief to Uganda (and many other African countries) to help them deal with the Covid-19 pandemic, but it is unclear whether the PLA was involved. At the time, China sent aid to Uganda. Besides the donation of protective gear, medicines and equipment, Uganda received a donation of Sinovac vaccines from the Chinese government.
UG.answerer: Answered by Abdou Rahim Lema, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

MZ.evidence: In my country the People’s Liberation Army (PLA) has participated in a humanitarian relief/disaster assistance (HADR) effort, such as in March 2019, during the Cyclone IDAI. According to the former Minister of Defence, the Chinese armed forces have been supporting Mozambique in responding to natural disasters such as cyclone IDAI, which devastated the country in March 2019. However, no recent evidence is available, so this question has been marked as "Skip".
MZ.note: According to Mozambique Government Platform, the People's Republic of China, through its Ministry of National Defence, donated 60,000 doses of vaccine for immunisation against the Covid-19 pandemic to the Mozambique Armed Defence Forces (FADM) in Maputo at the beginning of June 2021.
MZ.answerer: Answered by Tomé Bambo, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.
